comment: The class concepts isn't hard but the professor's relies on AI a lot. She admits on her syllabus she's an "AI user". She won't give out a study guides for her quizzes ( lockdown browser + Cam). She expects you to use AI as your study guide. Her portfolios will take up 7 hours+ it's 3 parts and a Narrative summary as your exams!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment:
I think she really cares about what she is teaching, but this class is much more difficult than it actually should be. It takes me way over 7 hours to work on this course per week. I barely have time for other courses. If you have time to invest, she is a good option to learn a lot.
Uses lockdown browser on all quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER! I do not know why she has such amazing reviews. She nitpicks at every small details on the portfolio assignments and will not let you know what's wrong until its too late. I ended with a high C and she refused to bump me up even though I scored A's on all the quizzes (All of them are Lockdown Browser by the way). Elicia Liar.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Lair was such an amazing professor! TAKE HER! Her class is laid out so beautifully and she really takes the time to make sure everyone understands the concepts! I will say there is a good amount of work but its all very easy if you are trying to learn. A lot of the work is creative based so you are free to choose your own activities.

This class was difficult but really well structured. My only criticism of her is that she was really slow to grade and give feedback on the Final Research Paper that you work on throughout the semester. There were too many times that she had her UTA's grade them for her, which is not very helpful. Every other aspect of her course is great though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment:
Great Professor! This was a fun class and she does a great job lecturing.Textbook assigned, but not needed. This class is only easy if you study!
Course Structure: Lectures from Powerpoints, Quizzes and Exam (lockdown browser with camera), and Reflection paper (I think, can't remember). I believe her structure has changed a little now though.

I'm taking Dr. Lair currently for social psychology. I was nervous for this course, but she makes it so easy and actually enjoyable. There are some lockdown quizzes but if you read the PowerPoints, you will be completely fine. Her portfolio projects are fun, and you get to choose from many different options on what you want to do. Def take her!
Just powerpoints mainly, you have portfolio assignments but as long as you complete sooner than later they arent stressful. guidelines are great she even gives templates for papers.

There are plenty of better professor options for Social Psychology at KSU. Overall, this course wasn't horrible, but Dr. Lair makes the course much harder than it needs to be. This course should not at all be too difficult given that it's 3000 level, but the class average grade for it was a 78% when I took it. Take her if there is no other option.

The best prof ive had. She has a clear passion for psych and it shows in how she teaches. She only grades attendance for half the semester, so if you go to abt 20 classes u fulfill ur grade. 3 exams, 6 quizzes, 3 discussion posts, and 2-3 homeworks. She is really kind and funny and applies social psych in such interesting ways! Easy if u study!

Awesome professor. I took her 8-week course+3 others while working full-time... she was very understanding and accepted the 2 assignments I finished late for full credit. I suggest starting Unit 2 assignments early, that way the majority of work for your final paper is done throughout the semester. I highly recommend taking 4100 with Dr. Lair

Good professor but she made the class harder than it needed to be. All quizzes & tests are lockdown with webcam and the questions on both are pretty specific. If you take the time to actually read through the PowerPoints and watch the videos you'll be okay. But If you're looking for something simple & not much effort I wouldn't take her.

This professor is very helpful and understanding. She gives excellent feedback that motivates you to want to do better. I learned so much in her course. This course consisted of 2 units, 1st unit SPSS analysis 2nd unit an experimental paper & PowerPoint presentation. I highly recommend Psych majors choose her for this required Psych course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Textbook provided in the course, no textbook purchase necessary. The professor is extremely helpful and understanding. She responds to emails almost instantly. The course has 2 unit.1st unit SPSS analysis assignments 2nd unit writing an experimental paper and a PP presentation. I highly recommend my fellow psych majors to choose this professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Lair makes Social Psychology very easy to understand. Attendance is mandatory until you reach your desired grade for attending class. She is passionate about what she teaches and there is a lot of class engagement. Very easy class, I recommend.

Loved her and really loved the material! Her ppt's had all the info you needed to study, which you HAVE to do. Workload isn't bad but all quizzes and tests are lockdown with web cam. If you seriously just take the time to go over the ppt's and her study guides you will get an A. Gives you 5 or so passes on attendance.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She was very knowledgable about the course. Lectures also consisted of group conversations with peers. Quizzes and exams are all Lockdown Browser with Camera. They aren't too bad, as long as you review the slides. There is a lot of material so prepare ahead of time. Homework assignments were quite easy as well. Solid choice for a professor.

Nice person/ responds to emails but honestly is no help when it comes to answering questions about assignments her TAs are even worse. If you do the work and review the material from PSYC 2500/3000 you should be able to pass this class. Be prepared to complete at least three assignments a week and start assignments early.

This was a pretty average class. You are required to go to 10 workshop wednesdays which are just discussion days. There's a good balance of homework, discussions, quizzes, and 3 tests including final. Tests and quizzes straight from the slides, which are really long and make studying pretty time consuming.

Such a sweet professor but class was beyond difficult when it didn't need to be. She is always accessible & easy to contact. Very knowledgeable about the content & wants to always make sure her students succeed. Wish the quizzes were a little less harsh since the content itself is interesting. Quizzes & Exams are lockdown + webcam.

She is honestly one of the best teachers I've ever had! I took a semester-long course from her in spring of 2022 and that one went really well. There were a few exams and homework, but they were all pretty simple. I just finished her 4 week summer class and it was super fast-paced, but it was still a really nice class. Definitley would recommend :)
I can't recommend Dr. Lair enough, her teaching style is organized, concise, interesting, and most of all she genuinely enjoys what she does. Thank you.

I took this professor for PSYC 4100. She is fantastic, and I would take her again and again if I could. There is a good bit of work in the course, but she explains everything well and gives excellent feedback on assignments. Be prepared to write a research paper throughout the class, but she explains it well! Good Luck!
I adore Dr. Lair. She has made research methods a breeze. Do not hesitate to reach out to her! She truly cares for her students and would love to help you. Take her class!!!

This is my second course with Professor Lair & I really like her. I found this course to be really interesting. 10 quizzes (lowest 4 gets dropped), 3 discussions (easy A), 3 homework assignments (easy A), & 3 tests with an optional final. You have to attend 3 Wednesdays throughout the semester but thats it. Take this professor if you can!

I took Professor Lair this most recent semester in her hybrid class. All work can be accessed at beginning of semester so you can complete it when you'd like, but be mindful of due dates so you don't miss any! I enjoyed this class and finished with an A. I actually learned a lot of information and would definitely take her again.

She was an amazing professor, I am taking the next class with her. I did every assignment and then I forgot to turn in the final, even though she has a no late assignments policy she took my final paper late because she knew I was a good student. 10/10, super happy with her.
Gave us less than 24 hours notice about one of our 2 exams. Ruthless with grading, does not work with you in the slightest.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Phenomenal professor! Always gives credit even if everything on the work is wrong. She gives everyone the opportunity to succeed. The exams are tough because this is tough material but she more than prepares you for it plus her TA's are always there to help. Anyone who struggled on the exams clearly didn't go to review sessions.

The syllabus and grading criteria is clear. She is very specific with how she wants things. Which leaves no room for error because your grade will reflect any minimum error. The main thing is her exams. Their almost impossible to pass . You are tested over 5 chapters at a time multiple choice with short answers . So good luck!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Lair has the "I want the best for you, but you must put in work" attitude. I loved her course! She had clear grading criteria. The assignments about mid-semester got a bit overwhelming, but every assignment benefits you for your final research study paper. Ask questions! She's always available to answer! Would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love Dr. Lair! I took her for research methods and it was structured so that during finals, you can just focus on your final paper for like 3 weeks. I think I would have gotten an A if it wasn't for Corona and we were able to get face to face feedback on my drafts. I'm taking her again for social psych and I'm excited! I would love to be her TA

Dr. Lair's lectures were interesting. She drops a test grade and your two lowest quiz grades. The book is not necessary as long as you read her powerpoints. The homework assignments were easy. The tests are easy as long as you study (she also curves the tests and has bonus questions). She offers extra credit as well.

Dr. Lair is well organized with her assignments and gives plenty of time to complete them each week. She is not a tough grader at all. Just make sure you follow the instructions given for discussion posts and adhere to the deadlines and you should do fine.

New professor at KSU. She is very flexible and lenient with her grading. Three exams, two mini papers, and a final paper. I was one of the few to get As on the tests. Study!! No grade for attendance but there are labs that can only be completed in classso dont miss. Way too much writing, but its coursewide. Uploads templates for all papers!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: i absolutely love Dr. Lair! She is the sweetest professor and truly cares about each of her students. She wants everyone to succeed and understand the material. If you ever have the chance to take one of her classes DO IT!

I enjoy psychology, but I didn't enjoy this class. She can easily be contacted via email, and is a wonderful grader who offers great feedback. I have two main issues: the exams/quizzes and the due dates. There is some confusion of when certain assignments are due. The exams were difficult and she uses a Lockdown webcam browser.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I love her, her class is so worth taking !

I take her online psychology class and it is a lot of work. The assignments are spread out and you can use notes on test and quizzes. There are 3 test and 8 or 9 quizzes I believe all using a lockdown browser. There's also discussions and Sona that you have to participate in but it's super easy. Kinda easy class with LOTS OF READING AND NOTES!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is Professor Lair's first semester at KSU. I currently am taking her social psychology course and enjoy every minute of it! She is very clear about her expectations. In my opinion, the weekly quizzes are more difficult than her tests. But when I say the only downside of her course is mandatory attendance, I mean it. Not too much work!
She is awesome!! She explains things really good, and is always willing to help you understand. Im in her class right now and its the best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects
